qas.question: When did MacDonald submit the resignation of his ministers?
What caused MacDonald to form a separate party?

answers.text: he and his supporters were promptly expelled

plausible_answers.text: MacDonald agreed to form a "National Government"

qas.question: What happened when the economic situation got better?
Who refused to form a National Government?
How did people in the Conservative Party feel about MacDonald's actions?
Who was expelled from the National Labour Organisation?
What election was an overwhelming victory for the Labour Party?

context: As the economic situation worsened <b3_0><b4_0>MacDonald<b4_0/> agreed to form a "National Government"<b3_0/> with the Conservatives and the Liberals. On 24 August <a0_0>1931<a0_0/> MacDonald submitted the resignation of his ministers and led a small number of his senior colleagues in forming the National Government together with the other parties. This caused <b5_0>great anger<b5_0/> among those within the Labour Party who felt betrayed by <b6_0>MacDonald<b6_0/>'s actions: <a1_0>he and his supporters were promptly expelled<a1_0/> from the Labour Party and formed a separate National Labour Organisation. The remaining Labour Party MPs (led again by Arthur Henderson) and a few Liberals went into opposition. The ensuing <b7_0>1931 general election<b7_0/> resulted in overwhelming victory for the <a2_0>National Government<a2_0/> and disaster for the Labour Party which won only 52 seats, 225 fewer than in 1929.
